title: ID a font please
content:
Can someone name the font used in this MK12 reel?  
It might be best to open this in a new window, [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045800/http:/www.mk12.com/video-popup.html?video=/v5_quicktime/2003/brazil.mov&title=BRAZIL%20INSPIRED%3A%20MACHO%20BOX&date=&info=2003&type=inhouse)

Thank you

 [‹ What is this font used on "Frock Me" show](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045800/http:/typophile.com/node/50659 "Go to previous forum topic") [poster typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045800/http:/typophile.com/node/50662 "Go to next forum topic")
author: paispais

comments.content:
I tried to view it but it didn’t show up.  
May want to repost link.

hmm... strange, it works on my end. Try this

[http://www.mk12.com/video-popup.html?video=/v5\_quicktime/2003/brazil.mov...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045800/http:/www.mk12.com/video-popup.html?video=/v5_quicktime/2003/brazil.mov&title=BRAZIL%20INSPIRED%3A%20MACHO%20BOX&date=&info=2003&type=inhouse "http://www.mk12.com/video-popup.html?video=/v5\_quicktime/2003/brazil.mov&title=BRAZIL%20INSPIRED%3A%20MACHO%20BOX&date=&info=2003&type=inhouse")
If that doesn’t work I’ll take a screen shot and post it.
Any ideas? I really like the “S” in this typeface and would like to incorporate it in a design.

FYI, if you only need to get the vector version of the text in a sample image, head on over to VectorMagic. It works really well. Better than the algorithm built into Illustrator.

[http://vectormagic.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045800/http:/vectormagic.com/ "http://vectormagic.com")

That is Clearwerkkraftremix by [Brad Barham](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023045800/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/clearlight/cl01.htm). Note that some of your characters will be found in the lowercase slots. Barham gave away his fonts as freebies years ago via his Clearlight Fonts website.
